# Service Decision

## Backend: Supabase

Chosen over Firebase and PocketBase for this project.

| | Supabase | Firebase | PocketBase |
|---|---|---|---|
| Database | PostgreSQL | NoSQL | SQLite |
| Google Auth | Built-in, free | Built-in, free | Built-in, free |
| Setup time | ~10 min | ~15 min | Self-hosted |
| Free tier | Generous | Generous | Free (self-host) |
| React SDK | Yes | Yes | Yes |

**Why Supabase:** Auto-generated REST API from DB tables, Row Level Security (RLS) for per-user data isolation, and no custom backend server needed. React calls Supabase directly.

Free tier limits: 500MB DB, 50k monthly active users, 2 projects.

## Auth: Google OAuth

Google OAuth is free. No billing from Google unless other Google Cloud services are used. Handled entirely through Supabase's auth provider settings.

## Frontend: React (Vite)

Vite for fast dev server and build. No Next.js — no SSR needed for this app.

## Charts: Recharts

Lightweight, React-native chart library. Used for all dashboard graphs.

## Deploy: Vercel

Free tier, connects directly to GitHub, zero config for Vite + React.

## Project structure

```
src/
├── pages/
│   ├── Dashboard.jsx      ← home page (graphs + today summary)
│   ├── Week.jsx           ← weekly planner
│   └── Login.jsx          ← google auth
├── components/
│   ├── charts/
│   │   ├── CompletionBar.jsx
│   │   ├── TimeDonut.jsx
│   │   ├── StreakCalendar.jsx
│   │   └── TrendLine.jsx
│   ├── TaskModal.jsx
│   └── WeekGrid.jsx
├── lib/
│   └── supabase.js        ← supabase client setup
└── App.jsx
```
